Posts.Content: I only had a lumpectomy and lymph node op, but I did buy one of those V shape pillows from Dunelm Mill in readiness and found it very useful for sleeping and still do.  I also used it on the settee when watching tv, I could usually put it in a position which I was comfortable in, I still use it 3 weeks later with one side under my normal pillow and the other down the side of me - it stops me rolling over onto my "op side".  They sell pillow cases to fit too.  Hope this helps you to sleep better. Carole xx

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with breast cancer following  routine mammogram, I noticed there was a lady at Calderdale Royal Hospital, and then saw her in Huddersfield Royal Infirmary when we were waiting for the dye to be injected.  I started a conversation with her and then found we were in next bed to each other for lumpectomy, swapped email and mobile numbers.  I asked the Radiogropher if we could be linked for appointments for radiotherapy appointments at Leeds Cancer Unit (St James, Jimmys) and they linked us on the appointment system.  It has been great to have had company of a lady who has had same breast cancer as me, and share the travelling experience, and been able to share our family niggles/and compare our side effects. I would suggest looking around and chatting to other patients, you never know if it could help you too.... Hope this suggion will help someon else xxxx

Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - Help please

Posts.Content: Hi Cbaz I know exactly how you feel, I called my start of mine brain mush! I was diagnosed with the same and had the lumpectomy and 2nodes removed last Wednesday (19/3/14). I am just waiting for the results from the nodes and hope to have them soon. The op wasn't too bad but surprisingly it is my arm pit which is the most tender, be prepared for your boob to feel swollen, that surprised me, feels like I did when breast feeding 40 years ago. I recommend a "Comfy bra" or two from asda £6 to wear night and day in the size above what you would normally buy.  Feel free to ask me any questions.  Good luck x

Posts.Content: Had my 13th session today and have blisters all around my breast area and my nipple feels swollen.  Have seen the Radiologist today too and she said if they start to break up I should speak to the nurse tomorrow when I go for session 14 or speak to the nurse on session 15 when I have an appointment with her as it is my final session. She said to continue using the Aquious cream for showering and moisturising until I see the nurse and they would give me some gel pads.   In the meantime I am going to put some facecloths in the fridge, should bey be wet flannels or dry? Posts.Content: Check with your breast care nurse first but I had my lumpectomy and 2 nodes removed 19 march and then went on holiday to Spain on 12 may for a week. Started rads on 21 St may  2 days after returning from Spain. All going OK but did not expose any of breast area to sun, factor 50 and a pretty scarf over left shoulder area. As for insurance had this ongoing for years with a credit card at bank, and just risked it on this occasion. However I have a holiday booked to Tunisia end of august and googled holiday insurance with cancer. Got 2 weeks cover for me and hubby including breast cancer and high cholesterol high blood pressure etc for about £56.00 . was happy with that . don't think I am covered for anything cancer related but I am not convinced that if I go abroad the cancer will make me have to brought home. Let me know if I can help you any further  Carole
Posts.Title: holidays after getting lump removed but before treatment?

Posts.Content: I know exactly what you mean.  When we took a weeks break to Spain after lumpectomy and before rads, I felt just like you.  I could get up each day, slap the suncream on and go out and be amongst people who did not know.  Even though at home I feel I want to share my experience to let others know that "hey, yes I have breast cancer, but it is treatable and I WILL survive! ask me anything you want about my experience, don't be afraid to mention it to me", somehow it was nice just to have a week away from it all. Book another holiday, I know I have!!! Carole
